itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, September 5, 2013
contentencoded:
The Federal Trade Commission has ruled that products made by the home security company TRENDnet are not as secure as the company has advertised. It's the first time the FTC has taken action to protect consumers from privacy invasions. TRENDnet sells cameras for a variety of home security purposes, including baby monitoring. Marketplace's Adriene Hill joins Morning Report host David Brancaccio to discuss.

title: F.T.C. says webcam company has security flaws
description: The Federal Trade Commission has settled a claim with maker of webcams over security problems
